Description: Painted acacia wood shabti of Heqanefer with a blue and yellow striped lappet wig, eyes traced with black, a red, blue and green collar, crossed hands in relief, the body painted is painted red and inscribed with nine rows of yellow painted hieroglyphs, the foot is damaged.
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 52 [18]. Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, Japan 1999-2000, [106].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 15 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondazione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
